The Difference Between Resilience & Sustainability? http://www.treehugger.com/infrastructure/difference-between-resilience-sustainability-zombie-apocalypse.html

I guess that the term ‘resilience’ has been around a while in the context of energy and agricultural systems, but I’ve only just heard about it. The essential idea is that building our infrastructure to be sustainable is not enough; we must build it to be resilient against shocks and disruptions that may occur through war, natural disasters, environmental change, etc.

As this article states it, it’s about “paying attention to where we are most vulnerable, and then taking steps to build redundancy and adaptability into our systems”.

 environment sustainability resilience treehugger green energy Jonathan Foley: The other inconvenient truth | Video on TED.com http://www.ted.com/talks/jonathan_foley_the_other_inconvenient_truth.html

I’ve been reading up a little bit on the huge impact that the growth of large-scale agriculture has had on the biosphere. Today’s interesting and devastating fact: the Aral Sea, once the world’s 4th largest lake, rivaling Lake Superior in size, is now all but dried up.

This TED talk by Jonathan Foley outlines the problem well with plenty of quick facts and graphics. Towards the end he begins to outline the path toward a solution, but it’s apparent that we still have a long way to go.
